intro: Ashtonia praeterita, commonly known as the slender ash tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to parts of southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it grows in rocky or sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, palmate leaves. It produces yellowish-white flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Ashtonia praeterita is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it thrives in well-drained, sunny conditions.
